alert.note: Alert for Marion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marion County through 345 PM CDT... At 256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Pittsburg, or 8 miles northwest of Bridgeport, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, South Pittsburg, Kimball, Monteagle, Orme, Haletown (guild), New Hope and Fiery Gizzard State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for east Tennessee.
